definition: weight/number/code/to pile/to stack/classifier for length or distance (yard), happenings etc
to put/to place/to release/to free/to let go/to let out/to set off (fireworks)

sentences.english: Keep the glass vertical when storage…
The workers stacked the bricks up against the wall.
sentences.chinese: 工人把磚頭整齊地碼放在牆邊。

sentences.english: Cover them with salt too. Continue putting fish and salt in the container until it is full.
sentences.chinese: 並重復碼放魚肉和撒鹽的過程直到容器裝滿。

sentences.english: All items placing need to according to hotel fire - fighting system, no more high.
sentences.chinese: 所有物品碼放需要按酒店消防制度進行，不得超高。

sentences.english: Casing should be placed on the racks in order, and stacked no more than three layers.
sentences.chinese: 井場套管應整齊平放在管架上，碼放高度不超過三層。

sentences.english: The seller shall be filed by the buyer in accordance with the requirements of carriage of the goods, the pieces.
sentences.chinese: 賣方應依照買方提出的要求進行貨物的運輸，碼放。

sentences.english: Pick over the fruit and pile on top of the cream.
sentences.chinese: 揀出好的水果，碼放在奶油上。

sentences.english: The beneath strutting must level off and equilibrium if lie flat, not suitable too high.
sentences.chinese: 若平放，底層支撐應平整均衡，碼放不宜過高。

sentences.english: When the sun is sinking, he lays the stones neatly next to the house.
sentences.chinese: 當太陽落山時，他將石頭整齊地碼放在屋子旁邊。
